qas.question: What kind of needlework was used in the creation of the Bayeux Tapestry?
What is Norman art's most well known piece?
What is the oldest work of Norman art?
Who commissioned Danish vikings to create the Bayeux Tapestry?

context: By far the most famous work of Norman art is <a1_1><a1_2><b3_0>the <a1_0>Bayeux Tapestry<b3_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, which is not a tapestry but a work of <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2>embroidery<a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. It was commissioned by <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b4_0>Odo<b4_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, the Bishop of Bayeux and first Earl of Kent, employing natives from Kent who were learned in the Nordic traditions imported in the previous half century by the Danish Vikings.
